intro: Ecbolium maingayi, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant features showy, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, and it has a fibrous root system. Its leaves are alternate and lobed, with a rough texture, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Ecbolium maingayi is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
